scenarios.description: A user reports receiving an email with a suspicious link claiming to be from IT. What do you do?

choices.text: Quarantine the email and report to security team
choices.feedback: Correct! Quarantining prevents phishing attacks and escalates appropriately.

choices.text: Click the link to verify it
choices.feedback: Wrong. Clicking unknown links can execute malware. Quarantine instead.

choices.text: Ignore the email and do nothing
choices.feedback: Not ideal. Ignoring risks other users falling for it. Report it.

scenarios.description: The security team confirms it’s a phishing attempt. They ask you to advise the user. What’s next?

choices.text: Educate user on spotting phishing emails
choices.feedback: Great! User education is key to preventing future incidents.

choices.text: Tell user to change their password immediately
choices.feedback: Not necessary yet—focus on education unless credentials were compromised.

scenarios.description: The email wasn’t quarantined, and another user clicked the link, downloading malware. What now?

choices.text: Isolate the affected device and notify security
choices.feedback: Correct! Isolating limits damage, and notifying escalates properly.

choices.text: Reboot the device to fix it
choices.feedback: Wrong. Rebooting may not remove malware and could spread it. Isolate first.

scenarios.description: A user calls saying their account is locked after entering their password incorrectly multiple times. What’s your first step?

choices.text: Verify the user’s identity before unlocking
choices.feedback: Correct! Identity verification prevents unauthorized access.
Wrong. Unlocking without verification risks security breaches.

choices.text: Ask the user to email their password for verification
choices.feedback: Never ask for passwords via email—it’s insecure and risks phishing.

scenarios.description: After verifying the user, you unlock their account. What should you advise them to do next?

choices.text: Set a stronger password and enable two-factor authentication
choices.feedback: Excellent! Strong passwords and 2FA enhance account security.

choices.text: Use the same password for simplicity
choices.feedback: Wrong. Reusing weak passwords increases vulnerability.
